key_points: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle intend to have their daughter Lilibet Diana's christening at St. George's Chapel, Windsor Castle.
They desire Queen Elizabeth's presence at the christening.
The decision is influenced by their special connection to Windsor, where they got married and first lived with their son.
Archie, their son, was also christened at St. Georgeâ€™s Chapel in a private ceremony in 2019.
Prince Harry hinted at the christening plans during his recent trip to the U.K. for the unveiling of a statue in honor of Princess Diana.
The family has been residing in California since their move last year, and Frogmore Cottage remains their official U.K. residence.
The ongoing coronavirus pandemic has complicated international travel plans.
This christening would mark the royal family's first in-person meeting with Lili and Meghan's return to the U.K. after over a year.
Their son Archie has not seen his U.K. relatives since the family relocated to the U.S. in late 2019.
Travel and safety precautions due to COVID-19 remain a consideration for the timing of the christening.
